weatherForecast.comment: Nighttime skies will be densely clouded, with intermittent rainfall/snow showers. On Friday, compact low-lying clouds and persistent light snowfall, severely reducing visibility. At 2000m: -4 degrees. Light-to-moderate N/NE winds, in high alpine terrain mostly southerly winds.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution: small-area snowdrift accumulations at high altitudes
avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is moderate at high altitudes. Fresh snow and drifts are trigger-sensitive esp on shady steep slopes, small-to-medium avalanches can be triggered by winter sports enthusiasts in steep terrain. Apart from the danger of being buried in snow masses, the risks of being swept along and forced to take a fall require adequate caution. On steep grass-covered slopes with sufficient snow on the ground or atop smooth ground, increasingly frequent small-to-medium glide-snow avalanches are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment: At high altitudes10-20 cm of fresh snow was registered on Thursday, on Friday another 5-15cm regionally, accompanied by moderate-velocity winds which will deposited fresh snowdrifts atop soft layers on shady slopes, often with blanketed graupel, bonding only moderately good. The highly diverse snowpack is well consolidated. Below 1500m there is little snow on the ground. On sunny slopes and at lower altitudes the fresh snow will fall on bare ground.

tendency.highlights: On Saturday, only intermittent snow showers. Avalanche danger levels not expected to change significantly.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution: small-area drifts at high altitudes
avalancheActivity.comment: Fresh snow and drifts are trigger-sensitive esp on shady steep slopes, small-to-medium avalanches can be triggered by winter sports enthusiasts in steep terrain. Danger zones occur esp. on ridgeline shady steep slopes and in extremely steep terrain. Apart from the danger of being buried in snow masses, the risks of being swept along and forced to take a fall require adequate caution. On steep grass-covered slopes with sufficient snow on the ground or atop smooth ground, increasingly frequent small-to-medium glide-snow avalanches are possible.

The highly diverse snowpack is well consolidated. Below 1500m there is little snow on the ground. On sunny slopes and at lower altitudes the fresh snow will fall on bare ground.

tendency.highlights: On Saturday, only intermittent snow showers. Avalanche danger levels not expected to change significantly.

customData.generalHeadline: Regionally increasing avalanche danger due to fresh snow and drifts
